item.title: A New Fallout 76 Update Is Live, Letting Players Finally Become A Ghoul
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/a-new-fallout-76-update-is-live-letting-players-finally-become-a-ghoul/1100-6530194/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Fallout 76 Season 20: Glow of the Ghoul is live with a massive update that lets players finally become a ghoul. The ghoul-themed season also includes a questline, a new landmark, and more.

Bethesda released a new trailer for the update, which can be viewed below, and it shows off a character's transformation from smooth skin to ghoul. It even highlights some of the options players can choose to make their ghoul unique in the game's character customization.

Players can transform their characters into ghouls as early as level 50. They'll be able to collect and equip 30 new ghoul-specific perk cards, giving new ways to build out characters and suit unique playstyles.

Glow of the Ghoul also adds the Leap of Faith questline and a new landmark in the Savage Divide. Ghoul-themed C.A.M.P. items are also available, including the radioactive Goo-Tub. Later in the season, players can expect a seasonal event called the Big Bloom, which begins on April 29.

According to Bethesda's roadmap for Fallout 76, the next big update after Glow of the Ghoul will arrive with Season 21 sometime in June.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: All DBD Codes March 2025 For Free Bloodpoints, Rift Fragments, Cosmetics, Badges, And More
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/all-dbd-codes-march-2025-for-free-bloodpoints-rift-fragments-cosmetics-badges-and-more/1100-6530193/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Dead by Daylight codes are a way for players to earn freebies in Behavior Interactive's killer-versus-survivors game. You might grab a few bonus Bloodpoints, some cool new in-game cosmetics, or perhaps one of the player badges has caught your eye. We've got all of the latest DBD codes, regularly tested to ensure they're still active.

New DBD codes

The currently active Dead by Daylight codes are:

  • CARNANEVOA25 - 300,000 Bloodpoints, 30 Rift Fragments, Hanging Umbrellas Banner, Confetti Mask Badge
  • IFLOOKSCOULDCHILL - Frosty Eyes Killer Cosmetic
  • REDDIT1MIL - 8-Bit Crow Badge
  • BDG2S - Two-spirit Badge
  • BDGAG - Agender Badge
  • BDGAR - Aromantic Badge
  • BDGB - Bisexual Badge
  • BDGDM - Demiromantic Badge
  • BDGGF - Genderfluid Badge
  • BDGGQ - Genderqueer Badge
  • BDGIS - Intersex Badge
  • BDGL - WLW Badge
  • BDGM - MLM Badge
  • BDGNB - Non-binary Badge
  • BDGP - Pansexual Badge
  • BDGPA - Polyamory Badge
  • BDGPRIDE - Pride Badge
  • BDGPRG - Progress Pride Badge
  • BDGT - Trans Badge
  • AROMFLAG - Aromantic Flag Charm
  • DEMISFLAG - Demisexual Flag Charm
  • POLYFLAG - Polyamory Flag Charm
  • TWOSFLAG - Two-spirit Flag Charm
  • FLAGL - WLW Flag Charm
  • MFLAG - MLM Flag Charm
  • FLAGB - Bisexual Flag Charm
  • FLAGP - Pansexual Flag Charm
  • ISFLAG - Intersex Flag Charm
  • AFLAGG - Agender Flag Charm
  • GFLAGF - Genderfluid Flag Charm
  • NBFLAG - Non-binary Flag Charm
  • GFLAGQ - Genderqueer Flag Charm
  • KINDRD - Glance of Pride Flag Charm
  • CAWCAW - Feathers of Pride Flag Charm
  • AFLAGS - Asexual Flag Charm
  • PRIDE - Rainbow Flag Charm
  • PRIDE2022 - Progress Pride Flag Charm
  • LETSROLL - Dwight Miniature Flag Charm
  • WARRIORPUPPERS - Warrior Puppers Flag Charm

How to redeem DBD codes

To redeem Dead By Daylight codes, follow these steps:

  • Go to the in-game store page
  • In the top right, click 'Redeem Code'
  • Copy and paste a code from the list above
  • Click 'Redeem'
  • Enjoy your freebies!

What are DBD code rewards?

The most common Dead by Daylight code reward is Bloodpoints, which can be used to improve your characters. To do this, go to the Bloodweb and spend them. You can choose to do this automatically, or purchase them individually. Each level adds perks and add-ons to your collection as well as leveling your character. To prestige your character, reach level 50 on the Bloodweb.

To get more DBD codes, bookmark this page as we'll be updating this guide regularly, as well as removing expired codes.

Cheri Faulkner on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: EA Will Pay Student-Athletes $1500 To Appear In CFB 26, More That Double Last Year's Rate
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/ea-will-pay-student-athletes-1500-to-appear-in-cfb-26-more-that-double-last-years-rate/1100-6530192/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

After paying college athletes $600 to appear in College Football 25, EA will pay players more than double that for this year's CFB 26. EA Sports confirmed to FBS players in an email today, obtained by The Athletic, stating that players will get $1,500 if they opt in to appear in this year's game. This is no surprise, as this information leaked earlier this year.

Additionally, players will receive a Deluxe Edition copy of the game--this was also offered in 2025. EA will pay some athletes more for appearing as brand ambassadors, just like last year.

A spokesperson for EA said, "College sports are growing and changing, and our focus at EA Sports is on continuing to put athletes first as we bring them in the game in College Football 26 and beyond."

More than 11,000 student-athletes appeared in CFB 25 through Name, Image, and Likeness (NIL) deals, with EA spending more than $6 million to cover that. A spokesperson told The Athletic that EA will double its payment to players to more than $16.5 million to help them feel recognized for the success of CFB 25. Of note, the $16.5 million figure reportedly does not include any further payments to certain players who have ambassador deals or for further payments to cover athletes.

That game was the No. 2 best-selling game of 2024 overall in the US, only surpassed by Black Ops 6. CFB 25 was the best-selling sports video game in US history based on dollar sales.

According to Front Office Sports, EA is also potentially going to negotiate royalty-based payments for certain players on top of the $1,500 appearance fee.

CFB 26 is in the works now and is expected to launch in July. EA Sports executive Daryl Holt told The Athletic that the team knew it was never going to be able to get everything it wanted to in 2024's game. "So there's a lot of meat left on the bone," he said.

Holt declined to get into specifics regarding new features for CFB 26, but teased, "We've got a lot of things still to come."

He added: "We release a game, we understand what's important to players and what they play and what they would like changed, improved or added. This is a game for fans built by college fans ourselves, and we want it to be that type of relationship to understand what's important to them."

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Rainbow Six Siege Crossover With The Boys Out Now With Homelander And Black Noir
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/rainbow-six-siege-crossover-with-the-boys-out-now-with-homelander-and-black-noir/1100-6530191/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Ubisoft has announced the newest crossover collaboration in Rainbow Six Siege, and it's none other than Prime Video's The Boys TV show. Two of the show's stars, Homelander and Black Noir, are now available in the tactical shooter.

The Boys bundle includes Aces as Homelander and Deimos as Black Noir. The bundle is available for 4080 R6 Credits, which is more than $30. The Homelander and Black Noir characters are available individually for 1944 R6 Credits each. Players get a variety of extras, as well, including a milk bottle charm for Homelander--and anyone who's seen the show or is aware of the lore knows what that means.

Homelander and Black Noir, along with other characters from The Boys, previously came to Call of Duty as DLC characters. Homelander also showed up in Mortal Kombat 1.

Some of Siege's previous licensed collaborations included Halo and Rick and Morty, just to name a few.

The Boys Season 5 is now in production and will be the final season of the popular superhero show. While the main series is ending, the spinoff Gen V is coming back for Season 2 this year, while a new prequel show, Vought Rising, is also in the works.

As for the Rainbow Six game series, Siege X is the next evolution of Rainbow Six Siege--but it's not Siege 2. The update arrives in June, adding the first new permanent game mode since launch, the 6v6 Dual Front, along with a range of visual and audio improvements. A closed beta for Siege X is happening now through March 19--here's how to sign up.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
